security_audit.summary: Pure markdown-based skill containing only instructional guidance for implementing responsive frontend designs. No executable code, network access, filesystem operations, or external command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Building responsive web interfaces that work across all device sizes is challenging without clear guidelines. This skill provides AI assistants with specific guidance on implementing mobile-first responsive designs using fluid layouts, breakpoints, and touch-friendly patterns.
actual_capabilities: Generate mobile-first responsive layouts using CSS Grid and Flexbox
Apply Tailwind CSS responsive utility classes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:, 2xl:)
Implement responsive typography that scales across breakpoints
Create touch-friendly UI elements with proper tap targets
Use relative units (rem, em, %, vh, vw) instead of fixed pixels
Test and optimize UI components for mobile, tablet, and desktop
limitations: Does not generate complete responsive websites from scratch
Does not provide design mockups or visual assets
Does not test designs on real devices or browsers
Assumes the AI already has access to the codebase being modified

use_cases.title: Building responsive React components
use_cases.description: Create or modify React components with responsive layouts that adapt seamlessly to any screen size.

use_cases.title: Implementing Tailwind responsive patterns
use_cases.description: Apply Tailwind CSS responsive utilities and breakpoints to style web interfaces with mobile-first approach.

use_cases.title: Optimizing touch interactions
use_cases.description: Design touch-friendly interfaces with proper sizing, spacing, and interactive elements for mobile users.

prompt_templates.title: Basic responsive component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a responsive card component that displays properly on mobile, tablet, and desktop screens.

prompt_templates.title: Navigation menu
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a responsive navigation menu that shows a hamburger menu on mobile and horizontal links on desktop.

prompt_templates.title: Image handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Create responsive image handling that adapts to different screen sizes and resolutions.

prompt_templates.title: Complex dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a responsive dashboard layout with grid that shows 1 column on mobile, 2 on tablet, and 4 on desktop.

output_examples.input: Create a responsive button component for mobile devices
output: Button with minimum 44x44px tap target for touch accessibility
Responsive padding using rem units (e.g., py-3 px-6)
Font size that scales appropriately (e.g., text-base or text-lg)
Active state feedback with visual touch indication
Mobile-first base styles with responsive overrides

best_practices: Start with mobile styles first and add breakpoints for larger screens using min-width approach
Use relative units (rem, em) for sizing to respect user font preferences and scaling
Ensure all interactive elements have minimum 44x44px tap targets for touch accessibility
Test layouts at common breakpoints (mobile < 640px, tablet 640-1024px, desktop > 1024px)
anti_patterns: Using fixed pixel widths instead of fluid percentages or max-width constraints
Hiding content on mobile instead of adapting it for smaller screens
Forgetting to test touch targets and interactive element spacing on actual devices

faq.question: What breakpoints does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill follows Tailwind CSS breakpoints: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px), and 2xl (1536px).

faq.question: Does this skill work with custom CSS instead of Tailwind?
faq.answer: Yes. The principles apply to any CSS approach. It provides guidance on media queries, flexbox, grid, and relative units.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for email templates?
faq.answer: Yes, but with limitations. Email clients have specific constraints. The skill can guide responsive patterns but email-specific CSS restrictions apply.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides guidance to the AI assistant. No code, content, or user data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why is my responsive layout not working on mobile?
faq.answer: Common issues include: missing viewport meta tag, using fixed pixel widths, not testing on actual devices, or CSS specificity conflicts.

faq.question: How is this different from other responsive design tools?
faq.answer: This skill guides AI assistants to write responsive code correctly from the start. It is not a design tool or testing framework but ensures best practices in generated code.
